New Records: Shami has now four five-fors in ODIs, the most by an Indian.
Shami is now also the leading wicket-taker for India in World Cups, going past Zaheer Khan and Javagal Srinath's tally of 44 each.

India have one of the most lethal bowling attack at this World Cup, spearheaded by their fast bowlers. Jasprit Bumrah has been exceptional in the powerplay, and Mohammed Shami as a first-change bowler is the envy of any team.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka 55 all out; India into the semis.
Sri Lanka 49 for 9, still one run short of their lowest ODI total.
Angelo Mathews has a great record both against India and in India. But today is not his day.
Shami pitches one full, not yorker-length full but pretty full. And it swings in. Mathews looks to drive with little footwork and the ball snakes through the gap between bat and pad.
Shami has another but this is as much KL Rahul's wicket as is Shami's.
Rajitha pokes at one, gets an outside edge and Gill takes a good catch, reverse cups, at second slip.
India won the match by 302 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit: It's a good pitch. There will be some assistance for bowlers at the start and then at night, it will be nice for our seamers to bowl.
India wanted to bat first, anyway.
Sri Lanka's stand-in captain Kusal Mendis calls Heads and it's Heads. Sri Lanka will bowl first.
Sri Lanka's players will wear black armbands today to pay tribute to Percy Abeysekera, the legendary cheerleader who died earlier this week.
The Sri Lanka players will wear black armbands today to pay tribute to Percy Abeysekera, the legendary cheerleader who died earlier this week.
Post-Match Reflections: Shami is the Player of the Match as well, his eventual figures of 5 for 18 are his personal best in ODIs.
A 302-run win, the fourth-largest ever, makes it seven out of seven for India. They are back at the top of the points table, and have become the first team to qualify for the semi-finals.
Shami has now four five-fors in ODIs, the most by an Indian.
Shami is now also the leading wicket-taker for India in World Cups, going past Zaheer Khan and Javagal Srinath's tally of 44 each.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The lowest all-out total in ODIs is 35, by Zimbabwe (vs SL) and USA (vs Nepal).
India won the match by 302 runs.
